meanings.definition: Not able to exist or work together harmoniously.
meanings.sent1: The red and blue paints were noncompatible for mixing.
meanings.sent2: The noncompatible personalities of the two friends often led to arguments.
meanings.sent3: The noncompatible puzzle pieces refused to fit together no matter how hard she tried.
meanings.sent4: Their noncompatible opinions clashed like thunder and lightning in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The noncompatible gears in the machine screeched in protest, refusing to turn smoothly.

meanings.definition: Not capable of being used together without conflict.
meanings.sent1: The two noncompatible software programs kept crashing when run simultaneously.
meanings.sent2: Their noncompatible schedules made it difficult to find a time to meet.
meanings.sent3: The noncompatible ingredients in the recipe resulted in a disastrous cake.
meanings.sent4: Their noncompatible goals clashed like swords in a medieval battle.
meanings.sent5: The noncompatible chemicals in the experiment caused a small explosion.

meanings.sent1: The noncompatible sizes of the shoes made it impossible to find a pair that fit.
meanings.sent2: Their noncompatible tastes in music made car rides awkward.
meanings.sent3: The noncompatible fonts on the poster made it hard to read.
meanings.sent4: Their noncompatible ideas collided like bumper cars at a carnival.
meanings.sent5: The noncompatible materials in the construction caused the building to collapse.
